<div align="center">

# Docker image for TTS WebUI ALL IN ONE

![Docker Pulls](https://img.shields.io/docker/pulls/ashleykza/tts-webui?style=for-the-badge&logo=docker&label=Docker%20Pulls&link=https%3A%2F%2Fhub.docker.com%2Frepository%2Fdocker%2Fashleykza%2Ftts-webui%2Fgeneral)
![Template Version](https://img.shields.io/github/v/tag/ashleykleynhans/tts-webui-docker?style=for-the-badge&logo=data%3Aimage%2Fsvg%2Bxml%3Bbase64%&logoColor=%23ffffff&label=Template%20Version&color=%23673ab7)

</div>

Web UI for:
- Ace-Step
- Kimi Audio
- Piper TTS
- GPT-SoVITS
- CosyVoice
- XTTSv2
- DIA
- Kokoro
- OpenVoice
- ParlerTTS
- Stable Audio
- MMS
- StyleTTS2
- MAGNet
- AudioGen
- MusicGen
- Tortoise
- RVC
- Vocos
- Demucs
- SeamlessM4T
- Bark

## Installs

* Ubuntu 22.04 LTS
* CUDA 12.8
* Python 3.11.12
* [TTS-WebUI](
  https://github.com/rsxdalv/TTS-WebUI)
* Torch 2.7.0
* xformers 0.0.30
* [Jupyter Lab](https://github.com/jupyterlab/jupyterlab)
* [code-server](https://github.com/coder/code-server)
* [runpodctl](https://github.com/runpod/runpodctl)
* [OhMyRunPod](https://github.com/kodxana/OhMyRunPod)
* [RunPod File Uploader](https://github.com/kodxana/RunPod-FilleUploader)
* [croc](https://github.com/schollz/croc)
* [rclone](https://rclone.org/)

## Available on RunPod

This image is designed to work on [RunPod](https://runpod.io?ref=2xxro4sy).
You can use my custom [RunPod template](
https://runpod.io/console/deploy?template=3zyimdisfg&ref=2xxro4sy)
to launch it on RunPod.

## Building the Docker image

> [!NOTE]
> You will need to edit the `docker-bake.hcl` file and update `USERNAME`,
> and `RELEASE`.  You can obviously edit the other values too, but these
> are the most important ones.

```bash
# Clone the repo
git clone https://github.com/ashleykleynhans/tts-webui-docker.git

# Log in to Docker Hub
docker login

# Build the image, tag the image, and push the image to Docker Hub
cd tts-webui-docker
docker buildx bake -f docker-bake.hcl --push
```

## Running Locally

### Install Nvidia CUDA Driver

- [Linux](https://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/cuda-installation-guide-linux/index.html)
- [Windows](https://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/cuda-installation-guide-microsoft-windows/index.html)

### Start the Docker container

```bash
docker run -d \
  --gpus all \
  -v /workspace \
  -p 3000:3001 \
  -p 3005:3006 \
  -p 7777:7777 \
  -p 8000:8000 \
  -p 8888:8888 \
  -p 2999:2999 \
  -e VENV_PATH="/workspace/venvs/tts-webui" \
  ashleykza/tts-webui:latest
```

You can obviously substitute the image name and tag with your own.

### Ports

| Connect Port | Internal Port | Description            |
|--------------|---------------|------------------------|
| 3000         | 3001          | TTS WebUI              |
| 3005         | 3006          | React TTS WebUI (beta) |
| 7777         | 7777          | Code Server            |
| 8000         | 8000          | Application Manager    |
| 8888         | 8888          | Jupyter Lab            |
| 2999         | 2999          | Runpod File Uploader   |

### Environment Variables

| Variable             | Description                                      | Default                    |
|----------------------|--------------------------------------------------|----------------------------|
| VENV_PATH            | Set the path for the Python venv for the app     | /workspace/venvs/tts-webui |
| JUPYTER_LAB_PASSWORD | Set a password for Jupyter lab                   | not set - no password      |
| DISABLE_AUTOLAUNCH   | Disable TTS WebUI from launching automatically   | (not set)                  |
| DISABLE_SYNC         | Disable syncing if using a RunPod network volume | (not set)                  |

## Logs

TTS WebUI creates a log file, and you can tail the log instead of
killing the service to view the logs.

| Application | Log file                |
|-------------|-------------------------|
| TTS WebUI   | /workspace/logs/tts.log |

For example:

```bash
tail -f /workspace/logs/tts.log
```

## Community and Contributing

Pull requests and issues on [GitHub](https://github.com/ashleykleynhans/tts-webui-docker)
are welcome. Bug fixes and new features are encouraged.
